Layout & Structure.contentWidthExceeds: Content width exceeds screen on desktop

Navigation.hamburgerMenuMissing: Hamburger menu missing or hard to tap

unused-javascript.title: Reduce unused JavaScript
unused-javascript.description: Remove unused JavaScript or defer loading scripts until they are required. This decreases bytes consumed by network activity.

unused-css-rules.title: Reduce unused CSS
unused-css-rules.description: Remove unused rules from stylesheets and defer CSS not used for above-the-fold content to decrease bytes consumed by network activity.

render-blocking-insight.title: Render blocking requests
render-blocking-insight.description: Some requests are blocking the page's initial render, which may delay the main content. Defer or inline these resources.

unsized-images.title: Image elements do not have explicit width and height
unsized-images.description: Set explicit width and height on image elements to reduce layout shifts and improve CLS metric.

landmark-one-main.title: Document does not have a main landmark
landmark-one-main.description: One main landmark helps screen reader users navigate a web page.

link-in-text-block.title: Links rely on color to be distinguishable
link-in-text-block.description: Low-contrast link text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Links should be distinguishable not only by color.

label-content-name-mismatch.title: Elements with visible text labels do not have matching accessible names
label-content-name-mismatch.description: Visible text labels that do not match the accessible name can result in a confusing experience for screen reader users.

charset.title: Charset declaration is missing or occurs too late
charset.description: A character encoding declaration is required. It can be done with a meta tag in the first 1024 bytes of HTML or in the Content-Type HTTP response header.

errors-in-console.title: Browser errors were logged to the console
errors-in-console.description: Errors logged to the console indicate unresolved problems. They can come from network request failures and other browser concerns.

csp-xss.title: Ensure CSP is effective against XSS attacks
csp-xss.description: A strong Content Security Policy (CSP) significantly reduces the risk of cross-site scripting attacks.

has-hsts.title: Use a strong HSTS policy
has-hsts.description: Deployment of the HSTS header significantly reduces the risk of downgrading HTTP connections and eavesdropping attacks.

meta-description.title: Document does not have a meta description
meta-description.description: Meta descriptions may be included in search results to concisely summarize page content.

link-text.title: Links do not have descriptive text
link-text.description: Descriptive link text helps search engines understand your content.
